name: Laser Knight
description:
Feedback Form

Fill this short form to let us know what we can improve about the game and your experience with it! Any help would be much appreciated! :)

https://forms.gle/DGpTbZg2LS9EJPdg8

The Story

It's a peaceful day inside the castle of King Spacetholomew. The inhabitants of the castle are feasting and dancing to celebrate the King's birthday inside the throne room: a yearly tradition  said to bring wealth and peace in the year to come.

Suddenly, the ground starts shaking and the celebrations are interrupted by a loud noise. "Sire, we've been attacked!".

There has been an invasion. Plasma Knight and his evil army of Hobbits, Ogres and Golems have captured the castle. 

Shocked, but not surprised the King calls upon his most loyal and powerful knight fend off the enemy.  Help us Laser Knight!

How to Play

Explore the castle and defeat you enemies with a short list of commands!

Controller
  • Left stick to move
  • A (Cross) to jump
  • RT (R2) to sprint
  • B (Round) to roll
  • X (Square) to attack
  • Y (Triangle) to use your special attack
  • LT (L2) to block
  • RB (R1) to use potions
  • Start to pause the game
Keyboard / Keyboard and Mouse
  • WASD or Arrow Keys to move
  • Spacebar to jump
  • Left Shift to sprint
  • C to roll
  • J or Left Mouse to attack
  • K or Middle Mouse to use your special attack
  • L or Right Mouse to block
  • P to use potions
  • Esc to pause the game
The Team

This game was made as a project for the Videogame Design and Programming course at Politecnico di Milano by the following people:

  • Riccardo Rossi - Team Leader,  Music Designer
  • Alessio Ferrara - Developer
  • Kristina Ropi - Developer
  • Haotian Zhang - Developer

The visual art was mostly downloaded from free-to-use asset packs available on the web and improvised by us.

We will release a list with credits to the artists whose work we used in the final version of the game.

DISCLAIMER

This is a prototype and does not represent the final version of the game. Any feedback would be much appreciated!  :)
